snippet: Western and African officials are increasingly concerned that the soldiers expected to continue the campaign against militants lack proper training and equipment.
abstract: Western and African officials are increasingly concerned that African soldiers who will be relied on to fight militants in Mali after France withdraws its troops are not prepared for the job; United States begins to help train and equip West African armies there, fearful that Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb and other militant groups could retain smaller but enduring havens in Mali if they are not effectively repelled.
lead_paragraph: Western and African officials are increasingly concerned that the soldiers expected to continue the campaign against militants lack proper training and equipment.

headline.seo: West Fears for Mali’s Fate After French Forces Leave
headline.main: Terror Haven in Mali Feared After French Leave
headline.print_headline: Terror Haven in Mali Feared After French Leave

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
keywords.name: organizations
